meanings.definition: A person who speaks with a particular accent.
meanings.sent1: The new student in our class is an accentors from France.
meanings.sent2: The accentors at the party had a strong Southern accent.
meanings.sent3: The accentors tried to imitate a British accent but ended up sounding funny.
meanings.sent4: She was like an accentors, adding a touch of uniqueness to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The accentors stood out in the crowd with their distinct way of speaking.

meanings.definition: A bird of the Old World family Prunellidae, typically having a streaked brown plumage.
meanings.sent1: We spotted a group of accentors perched on the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The accentors chirped melodiously in the early morning.
meanings.sent3: The accentors gathered around the bird feeder, squabbling over seeds.
meanings.sent4: The accentors blended perfectly with the autumn leaves, camouflaging themselves.
meanings.sent5: The accentors' song echoed through the forest, filling the air with music.
